topic: Police rape case investigators confirm video of sex act in Paris courthouse cell

ideas.title: Tribunal Tripadvisor
ideas.premise: A Tripadvisor review of the Palais de Justice cell, featuring 5-star ratings for 'atmosphere' and 'inclusivity', but 1-star for 'privacy'.
ideas.why_funny: Irony of using a review site for a jail cell is unexpected and relatable.

ideas.title: Justice au Naturel
ideas.premise: A sign outside the Palais de Justice reading 'Justice au Naturel' (Justice Naturally) with a fig leaf covering the 'Palais'.
ideas.why_funny: Play on words using a common French phrase to suggest scandalous behavior.

ideas.title: Sarkozy's New Campaign Slogan
ideas.premise: Nicolas Sarkozy, desperately trying to regain relevance, adopts the new campaign slogan, 'Experience counts!' while winking suggestively.
ideas.why_funny: Uses Sarkozy's public image and implies experience in scandalous behavior.

ideas.title: The New Louvre Exhibit
ideas.premise: Tourists gather around a darkened cell within the Louvre, staring at a projected shaky, pixelated video labeled 'Untitled Performance Piece (Courthouse Cell, 2024)'.
ideas.why_funny: Satire on the absurdity of modern art and its relationship with scandalous events.

ideas.title: Baguette Break
ideas.premise: Two gendarmes standing outside the courthouse, one saying to the other, 'Well, at least *we* just use our lunch break for baguettes and coffee.'
ideas.why_funny: Contrast between mundane police break and shocking incident for dark humor.
